intro: Senecio scorzonella, commonly known as the sticky senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
